page.title: 16HISTORIC HOUSE NAILSWORTH
page.content: Built in the 16th century - formally two houses, converted to one in 1880's It is built with Cotswold stone and was the home of{W. H. Davies}who was born in Newport (1871) and died here in 1940. On the wall of the house there is a quote from his famous poem{'Leisure'} The house now belongs to his grandson. At the end of the cottage there used to be a shop (early 20th century). In the same area of{Watledge}most of the old cottages were weavers' cottages. {Whipps Lane}is so named because donkeys carrying their loads of fleeces were whipped up the hill.
